page.title: 01LANDSCAPE FARMING HABITATION
page.content: This area is predominately open countryside which is good quality farmland. This is put either to pasture or cereals although some kale is grown for fodder. Sheep are raised and also cattle, both for fattening and milk production. The whole area is bisected north west to south east by a major road, the A6, and also the main Leicester to St. Pancras railway line. Also a length of the Grand Union canal meanders through the southern section of the area. Housing is sparse over most of the area, except in the main centres of habitation, the villages of Kibworth Beauchamp and Smeeton Westerbylocated in the north western corner.A number of quite new housing developments extend from Kibworth Beauchamp.
